required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on April 10, 2017
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Drug Exposure and Depot Medroxyprogesterone Acetate (DMPA) in Adolescent Subjects
clinical_study.official_title: Relationship Between Drug Exposure and DNA Markers With Depot Medroxyprogesterone Acetate-associated Side Effects in Adolescents

brief_summary.textblock: The investigators are doing this study to look at how different doses of the Depot medroxyprogesterone acetate (DMPA) shot effect weight gain and bone mineral density in teens. The investigators hope that what the investigators learn from this study will be used to develop ways to keep girls from gaining weight or losing bone density when receiving DMPA.

detailed_description.textblock:
Depot medroxyprogesterone acetate (DMPA) is a generic form of the DepoProveraÂ® shot. When receiving the birth control shot some girls gain a lot of weight while others do not. Some girls also lose bone mineral density (BMD). Bone mineral density is the amount of weight and thickness of the bones.
In this study 1 of 3 doses of DMPA will be given as an injection into the muscle in the arm. The 150mg dose is approved for use in this age group by the Food and Drug Administration (FDA) when given into the muscle. The 104mg dose is approved for use in this age group by the FDA only when given under the skin therefore it is considered experimental. The 75mg dose is also considered experimental as this dose is not FDA approved regardless of how it is given.

primary_outcome.measure: Number of adolescents who enroll and proportion who return for scheduled follow up visits.
primary_outcome.description: Subject participation is 48 weeks, enrollment period is up to 12 months so the estimated time for analysis is after all study visits are complete, which may be up to 2 years.

primary_outcome.measure: Change in lumbar spine bone mineral density (BMD) at 48 weeks
primary_outcome.description: Individual subjects will be assessed after their Week 48 visit.

primary_outcome.measure: Proportion of participants with >5% weight gain at 24 weeks
primary_outcome.description: Individual subjects will be assessed after their Week 24 visit.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change in total hip and femoral neck BMD at 48 weeks
secondary_outcome.description: Individual subjects will be assessed after their Week 48 visit.

secondary_outcome.measure: Proportion of subjects with >10% weight gain at 48 weeks
secondary_outcome.description: Individual subjects will be assessed after their Week 48 visit.

clinical_study.condition: Disorder of Bone Density and Structure, Unspecified

intervention.description: 75mg, 104mg and 150mg DMPA, IM, every 12 weeks for 12 months
intervention.other_name: Generic Depo Provera manufactured by Greenstone, LLC

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
1. Age 12-21 years
2. Healthy, post-menarcheal female
3. Self-selected to initiate depot medroxyprogesterone acetate (DMPA)
4. Willingness to use a barrier method of contraception in addition to DMPA
Exclusion Criteria:
1. Chronic disease known to affect weight or bone mineral density (BMD) (e.g. diabetes, kidney)
2. Use of medication known to affect weight or BMD (e.g. corticosteroids)
3. DMPA use within the past 12 months
4. Pregnancy within the past 6 months
5. Etonogestrel implant, levonorgestrel-releasing intrauterine system or combined estrogen/progesterone contraceptive use within the past 30 days (OC, patch, vaginal ring)
6. Weight exceeding 450 lbs
7. Need for confidential contraceptive care for individuals < 18 years of age.

responsible_party.investigator_title: Assistant Professor, Department of Pediatrics, The Ohio State University
